passage_text: Deciduous forests can be found in the eastern half of North America, and the middle of Europe. There are many deciduous forests in Asia. Some of the major areas that they are … in are southwest Russia, Japan, and eastern China. South America has two big areas of deciduous forests in southern Chile and Middle East coast of Paraguay.

There is a large area of concentrated temperate forests in Asia; mostly northeast Japan and eastern China. In South America there are two areas of temperate forests in southern Chile and the Middle East coast of Paraguay. There are also temperate forests located in New Zealand, and southeastern Australia. They are also located in the eastern of Canada, because Canada is between 23.5 degrees and 55 degrees N and S

LOCATION: Most temperate, deciduous (leaf-shedding) forests are located in the eastern United States, Canada, Europe, China, Japan, and parts of Russia. Deciduous forests are broken up into five zones. The firstzone is the tree stratum zone.

Deciduous forests can be found in the eastern half of North America, and the middle of Europe. There are many deciduous forests in Asia. Some of the major areas that they are … in are southwest Russia, Japan, and eastern China. Tropical deciduous forests are found in India, Myanmar, South China, East Brazil and Central parts of America. These forests thrive in regions where the climate is hot with di … stinct wet and dry seasons.

Located mid-latitude; between 23.5 degrees and 55 degrees N and S. Temperate forests are typically found in the eastern half of North America, and mid regions of Europe, and eastern Black Sea regions near southwest Russia. In South America there are two areas of temperate forests in southern Chile and the Middle East coast of Paraguay. There are also temperate forests located in New Zealand, and southeastern Australia.

L ooking closely at the biome map below, you'll see that the temperate deciduous forests are located primarily in the eastern half of the United States, Canada, Europe, parts of Russia, China, and Japan. Disclaimer. Copyright © 2002 Missouri Botanical Garden.
Their is not much Temperate Forest in the world with Australia, New Zealand and Canada taking the bigger chunk.
Geographic Distribution. The Temperate Rainforest is located in different areas across the world. Its located in part (1/3) North American, Western Europe, China, Korea, Japan, and Australia.

Temperate Forest. Location and Land. The Temperate Forest is located in many places in both the Northern and Southern Hemispheres. Some places where Temperate Forests can be found are China, Japan, New Zealand, Spain, South Africa, Chile, Marquis, Andes, Alps, and the Himalayas. The continents which include parts of this biome are North America, Australia, Europe, Asia, South America, and Africa.

A rainforest is a forest differentiated by high levels of precipitation-normally a minimum of at least 68-78 inches (172-198 cm) annually. Rainforests tend to have fairly mild and/or warm climates and feature the highest levels of biodiversity in the world. These forests are small and scattered but are always found on the coast (map of temperate rainforests) . Some of the larger temperate rainforests are on the northwest coast of North America, southeastern Australia, Tasmania, New Zealand, and the southwest coast of South America.
